text:
this <https://www.lifl.fr/~sedoglav/Load/Sedoglavic2002.pdf> algorithm is efficient for local identifiability analysis, I started putting together some draft code for it, this is not ready yet, but any feedback is welcome: <https://github.com/iliailmer/local-identifiability>
i wonder how Symbolics/MTK will work with AbtractAlgebra and modular arithmetic for power series.

elements.text: algorithm is efficient for local identifiability analysis, I started putting together some draft code for it, this is not ready yet, but any feedback is welcome:
i wonder how Symbolics/MTK will work with AbtractAlgebra and modular arithmetic for power series.

text: Very nice! I was reading up on identifiability from the Lie Algebraic perspective the last two days and wanted to implement a similar approach, albeit from a brute force perspective over a known trajectory. I will read the paper a little more thoroughly and provide some feedback :wink:
